1. Classification
▪ Predictive modeling: the task of building a model y = f(x)
– y: the target variable
– x = (x1, x2, …, xn): the explanatory variables
▪ Two types of predictive modeling
– Classification: when y is categorical (e.g., ‘cat’(0), ‘dog’(1), ‘human’(2))
• (ex) predicting whether a web user will make a purchase (y = 1(yes) or 0(no))
– Regression: when y is numerical (e.g., any value from [-20, 50])
• (ex) forecasting the future temperature of an area (y = 32.7C)
▪ Goal
– Learn a model f(x) that minimizes the error between the predicted and 
true values of the target variable
